title: Rod Phillips To Join Toronto Global Board of Directors As New Chair
description: Toronto Global, a regional economic development organization, has appointed Rod Phillips as its new chair. Phillips, with extensive experience in business and public policy, will play a key role in attracting foreign direct investment and fostering economic growth in the Greater Toronto Region. The board also acknowledged the leadership of outgoing chair Mark Cohon, who has served since the company's founding in 2017.
keywords: Toronto Global,Rod Phillips,Mark Cohon,foreign direct investment,economic growth,Greater Toronto Region

title: 1 Growth Stock Down 38% to Buy Right Now
description: AMD's data center business is its largest revenue source, growing at triple-digit rates. This demand for the company's advanced server chips could make the stock a compelling buy heading into 2025, despite mixed performance across its other business segments.

title: Could Buying Roku Stock Today Set You Up for Life?
description: Roku, a leading streaming platform, faces competition from both TV manufacturers and streaming services, but its large user base and cash-flow generation make it an intriguing long-term investment idea. The market's skepticism about Roku's business model has weighed on the stock's valuation, which could see significant upside if the company can maintain its growth momentum and turn a profit.

title: 3 Unstoppable Stocks With Competitive Moats That Appear Poised to Become Wall Street's Next Stock-Split Stocks in 2025
description: The article discusses three companies - Meta Platforms, Netflix, and Costco Wholesale - that are well-positioned to announce stock splits in 2025 due to their strong competitive positions and financial performance.

title: Disney Investors Just Got Fantastic News, but Is the Stock a Buy?
description: Disney has struggled with its streaming efforts, but recent results show progress. The stock is trading at a low valuation, but there are still risks ahead as the company searches for a new leader. Investors may want to take a small position on the chance of Disney's rebound.

title: Billionaire Jerry Jones Just Explained Why Live Sports Is a No-Brainer for Netflix. Is the Streaming Stock About to Pop Again?
description: Billionaire Jerry Jones believes that Netflix's foray into live sports, including NFL games, could be a game-changer for the streaming service. The article suggests that live sports could help Netflix attract new subscribers and increase engagement among existing ones.

title: The Future of Live Sports on Netflix: Lessons Learned From Problems With the Tyson-Paul Event
description: Netflix encountered technical issues during its first live sports event, the boxing match between Mike Tyson and Jake Paul. The article discusses the lessons Netflix learned and the challenges it may face in delivering high-quality live sports coverage in the future.

title: The Best Stocks to Invest $50,000 in Right Now
description: The article discusses a hypothetical $50,000 tech-focused portfolio, with 40% allocated to Netflix, 5% to Reddit, and 50% to Amazon. Netflix has survived competition and thrived, Reddit is a promising but unproven stock, and Amazon is a proven winner with solid growth and profitability.

title: Is The Trade Desk Stock a Buy?
description: The Trade Desk, a digital advertising company, reported strong Q3 results, but its stock price fell due to valuation concerns. The company is well-positioned to benefit from the growing digital advertising market, particularly in the connected TV (CTV) segment. However, its current valuation is considered high, and investors may want to wait for further acceleration in the company's bottom line before considering buying more shares.

title: 3 Soaring Stocks to Hold for the Next 20 Years
description: The article discusses three stocks - Netflix, Royal Caribbean Cruises, and Intuitive Surgical - that have recently surged in value but are still considered great long-term investments due to their strong growth potential and competitive advantages.
keywords: Netflix,Royal Caribbean Cruises,Intuitive Surgical,long-term investment,growth stocks

title: Investing $2,000 in Each of These 3 Growth Stocks 20 Years Ago Would Have Made You $3.8 Million
description: Investing $2,000 each in Nvidia, Netflix, and Apple 20 years ago would have resulted in a $3.8 million portfolio today. These growth stocks have generated life-changing returns, highlighting the potential of investing in promising companies despite the unpredictability of their performance.

title: Should Netflix Replace Tesla in the "Magnificent Seven"?
description: The article argues that Netflix should replace Tesla in the prestigious 'Magnificent Seven' group of stocks, as Netflix is performing better than Tesla in recent times. It highlights Netflix's strong subscriber growth and profitability, while Tesla has faced slowing growth and margin pressures.

title: Netflix In Hot Water As Tax Fraud Investigators Raid French, Dutch Offices: Report
description: Netflix's offices in France and the Netherlands were raided by tax fraud investigators as part of a preliminary inquiry into alleged financial crimes and corruption. The investigation is focused on potential tax fraud and money laundering by the streaming giant.

title: 1 Monster Stock That Turned $10,000 Into Almost $5.6 Million in 20 Years
description: Netflix, founded in 1993, has grown to become a global media powerhouse with over 283 million customers. Despite its impressive growth and profitability, the stock appears to be richly valued, and investors should not expect the same level of gains going forward.

title: Oscar Contenders Spotlight Native Indigenous Storytellers at LA’s 29th Red Nation International Film Festival, November 8 - 16 at AMC The Grove
description: The 29th Annual Red Nation International Film Festival in Los Angeles will feature two acclaimed Native Indigenous documentary films, 'SUGARCANE' and 'YINTAH', in partnership with Netflix and National Geographic. The festival will showcase 76 official selections, with nearly half directed by women, highlighting the growing representation of Native and Indigenous voices in the film industry.
keywords: Red Nation International Film Festival,Native Indigenous,documentary films,Netflix,National Geographic

title: How Much Is Netflix Stock Actually Worth?
description: The article discusses The Motley Fool, a financial services company dedicated to making the world smarter, happier, and richer. The company reaches millions of people through its premium investing solutions, free guidance, and market analysis on Fool.com, top-rated podcasts, and non-profit The Motley Fool Foundation.
